intro: Radicula nana, commonly known as the dwarf radicula, is a small flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tiny, delicate leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows close to the ground, often in rocky or sandy soils, and is adapted to cold climates. Radicula nana has a short growing season and relies on rapid growth and reproduction to survive in its harsh environment. Its botanical features make it an important indicator species for studying plant adaptation in extreme conditions.
